subject: AI & Agents
title: Who Owns AI-Generated Content?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Who Owns AI-Generated Content?.

hook.text: An AI generates a hit song. Who owns it â€” the user, the AI company, or the artists it trained on?

buildup.text: Copyright law was written for human creators. AI-generated content fits nowhere in existing frameworks.

discovery.text: The US Copyright Office ruled that purely AI-generated works can't be copyrighted. No human author, no copyright.

twist.text: But if a human guides AI with detailed prompts and curation, the line between human and AI creation blurs.

climax.text: Lawsuits from artists, writers, and musicians against AI companies are reshaping intellectual property law.

punchline.text: The law was built for pen and paper. Now it faces the algorithm.

quiz.question: What did the US Copyright Office rule about AI-generated works?
options: Purely AI-generated works cannot be copyrighted
All AI outputs automatically belong to the AI company
AI-generated works have the same rights as human works
